definition: (old) itinerant political adviser/(fig.) lobbyist/go-between/mouthpiece/also pr. [shuo1 ke4]
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
customer/visitor/guest

sentences.english: Lobbyists use slush fund to bribe public officials.
sentences.chinese: 院外集团的说客用贿金拉拢政府官员。

sentences.english: The problem is the role that lobbyists have come to play.
sentences.chinese: 问题在于说客应该扮演一个什么样的角色。

sentences.english: There already is a long line of lobbyists bidding for federal money.
sentences.chinese: 向联邦政府伸手要钱的说客已经排成了一条长龙。

sentences.english: Home of the little girl water lotus also served as lobbyists.
sentences.chinese: 驻地的小姑娘水莲还主动当起了说客。

sentences.english: Corporations and trade associations are recruiting Democratic lobbyists.
sentences.chinese: 企业和同业工会正雇用民主党说客。

sentences.english: Fakir is a fictitious world constructed with "fairy-tale".
sentences.chinese: 《痴愚说客》是用“童话”演绎的虚拟世界。

sentences.english: Some companies that have hired lobbyists are looking for research and development help.
sentences.chinese: 一些雇佣了说客的公司正在寻求研究开发方面的帮助。

sentences.english: But Wall Street’s lobbyists may well succeed in blunting the bill’s impact.
sentences.chinese: 但是华尔街的说客也能使这项法案失效。

sentences.english: All of Hank's friends tease him about being a tree hugger because of his great love of nature.
sentences.chinese: 汉克挚爱自然，所有的朋友都笑称他为环保说客。

sentences.english: It also rebuffed MPs' demands for a register of lobbyists.
sentences.chinese: 它还回绝了议员关于说客登记的要求。

definition: to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
peacemaker/mediator/(derog.) fixer
lackey/errand boy/lit. runner before a carriage
shield/(fig.) excuse
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to persuade
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to intercede/to plead for sb else
prevail/convince
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to send punitive forces against/(fig.) to criticize violently
intermediary/mediator
messenger/communicator/relay
(derog.) inept advisor/a good-for-nothing adviser/one who offers bad advice
scapegoat/fall guy
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
